profile.name: BEMELINGUE Wilfried
profile.title: Computer Engineering student specialized in AI, Deep Learning and Machine Learning
profile.summary: Currently seeking a 6‑month final internship in AI, Deep Learning and Machine Learning. Open to international opportunities. Based in Île-de-France, France, bilingual in French and fluent in English (TOEIC in progress).

experiences.title: Intern – Script Optimization and Migration
experiences.description: Migrated scripts to Airflow on AWS, optimized Python scripts and SQL queries, implemented a JSON-based retry system, created KPIs for BI dashboards, improved GitLab CI/CD pipelines.

education.degree: Major in Smart Computing for Artificial Graphs (4th and 5th years, final year in progress, accredited by CTI)
education.details: The SCIA‑G major trains engineers to design and apply artificial intelligence on graph-structured data. It covers data visualization, big data, machine learning, distributed systems, and recommendation algorithms, with complex projects and a strong focus on research and innovation.

projects.title: Analysis and Prediction of Road Accidents
projects.description: Project combining data visualization, big data, and machine learning: processing and analysis of accident data, supervised and unsupervised modeling, model evaluation, and result interpretation.

projects.title: Differentiable Programming
projects.description: Rebuilding a deep learning library similar to PyTorch to understand automatic differentiation and backpropagation.

projects.title: Recommender Systems

education.degree: Engineering Degree in Computer Science (3rd year, accredited by CTI)
education.details: In the 3rd year of the engineering cycle, students follow intensive programming bootcamps (piscines), collective projects, and 'rush' challenges. This immersive pedagogy strengthens core skills, builds resilience, and simulates demanding professional environments.
